Key Match Events: Eduardo Vargas scored a sensational headed effort to give Chile an early lead
Igor Jesus headed home to draw Brazil level just before the half-time break
Luiz Henrique drilled a low-driven effort into the bottom-left corner to seal the win for Brazil in the 89th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Dorival Junior's tactics were disastrous, and he is now on thin ice after the disappointing performance
The pressure on the manager is likely to increase after such a disjointed performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil defeated Chile 2-1 to move up to fourth in the CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying table, leapfrogging both Ecuador and Bolivia in the process
Others: Ederson, Abner, Marquinhos, and Danilo all had solid performances, but did not stand out
Savinho had a great performance, showing some neat footwork and providing a brilliant assist for Igor Jesus' strike
Rodrygo and Raphinha struggled in their roles, and did not look comfortable alongside Jesus and Savinho
